revised_title: Interface Doping for Control of Electrical Barriers in Semiconductor Heterojunctions
tldr: The authors demonstrate that the electrical barriers at semiconductor heterojunctions can be controlled by altering the interface electric dipole through interface doping. They discuss various methods to modify the band offsets, including strain and alloy composition, and the introduction of interlayers at or near the interface. This control over band alignment can lead to improved performance in semiconductor devices.
